questions.explanation:
7. What type of food does that store sell?
(A) What a delicious recipe. → Incorrect (unrelated to the store's food)
(B) They have all kinds of cheese. → Correct (specifies the type of food sold)
(C) With a new jacket. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

8. When should we leave for the airport?
(A) This afternoon at two o'clock. → Correct (specifies the departure time)
(B) I prefer an aisle seat. → Incorrect (refers to seating, not time)
(C) Mr. Choi traveled there last year. → Incorrect (unrelated to departure time)

9. Where's the hiring event being held?
(A) She sent it to a colleague. → Incorrect (unrelated to the event location)
(B) In the main conference room. → Correct (specifies the location)
(C) If they open on time. → Incorrect (refers to timing, not location)

10. Why is the budget being updated?
(A) When we rented the building. → Incorrect (refers to time, not reason)
(B) With the new designs. → Incorrect (unrelated to budget update)
(C) Because new sales figures came in. → Correct (explains the reason)

11. Can you cover my shift at work tomorrow?
(A) No, I'm taking the day off. → Correct (addresses availability for the shift)
(B) Before he updated the Web site. → Incorrect (unrelated to covering the shift)
(C) It's on the agenda for Tuesday. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)

12. Who ordered these vegetables?
(A) All of it. → Incorrect (refers to quantity, not person)
(B) I believe Luis did. → Correct (identifies who ordered the vegetables)
(C) It was excellent, thanks. → Incorrect (unrelated to the question)

13. How often should I mail the notices?
(A) Once a month. → Correct (specifies the mailing frequency)
(B) After three o'clock. → Incorrect (refers to time of day, not frequency)
(C) About half of them. → Incorrect (refers to quantity, not frequency)

14. Which folder are the documents in?
(A) We agreed on the deadline. → Incorrect (unrelated to document location)
(B) Sure, I'll take a look. → Incorrect (offers action but not specific location)
(C) Let me show you. → Correct (implies guiding to the folder)

15. Did you end up going to a movie or to the concert last night?
(A) I saw the new action film. → Correct (specifies the activity chosen)
(B) It just ended. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated to the choice)
(C) Just a couple of my friends. → Incorrect (refers to companions, not activity)

16. We'll take the company bus to the conference center.
(A) I'm sure it's not. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) Maybe we did. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the bus plan)
(C) That's a good plan. → Correct (agrees with the transportation plan)

17. What should we put in the introduction to the report?
(A) After the summary. → Incorrect (refers to placement, not content)
(B) The research highlights. → Correct (suggests content for the introduction)
(C) I met him yesterday. → Incorrect (unrelated to the report)

18. We should have a new logo designed.
(A) They're about five miles from here. → Incorrect (refers to distance, not logo)
(B) I know a good graphic artist. → Correct (offers a solution for the logo)
(C) An order for some new calendars. → Incorrect (unrelated to logo design)

19. Did you select a site for the new headquarters?
(A) Is that so? → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) No one can attend the training. → Incorrect (unrelated to headquarters site)
(C) Yes, in the center of town. → Correct (confirms site selection)

20. Who's going to cancel the meeting?
(A) Martin is the most senior team member. → Correct (this answer)
(B) Josie's chair is broken. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) The client signed the contract. → Incorrect (unrelated to canceling)

21. How was your business trip?
(A) They found some just in time. → Incorrect (unrelated to trip experience)
(B) I like that idea. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) It was very productive. → Correct (describes the trip experience)

22. Why did Chae-Won hire an assistant?
(A) She will submit an estimate in September. → Incorrect (unrelated to hiring reason)
(B) Anyway, they thought I was late. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) Haven't you noticed how busy she is? → Correct (explains the hiring reason)

23. Would you mind showing me the new office space?
(A) I think that's correct. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated)
(B) Sure—it won't take long. → Correct (agrees to show the office space)
(C) Everyone available participated. → Incorrect (unrelated to the request)

24. We're trying to decide where to order from for lunch.
(A) I loved those sandwiches from Gino's last week. → Correct (suggests a lunch option)
(B) My brother's friend was there. → Incorrect (unrelated to lunch order)
(C) I remember that song very well. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

25. When do you plan to finish the advertising campaign?
(A) Next to Irina's office. → Incorrect (refers to location, not time)
(B) By Monday morning at the latest. → Correct (specifies completion time)
(C) Because it didn't make sense to me. → Incorrect (unrelated to timing)

26. Where will the guest speaker be joining us from?
(A) Nobody shared the details with me. → Correct (addresses lack of location info)
(B) He wasn't gone too long. → Incorrect (unrelated to location)
(C) First thing in the morning, I believe. → Incorrect (refers to time, not location)

27. Wouldn't you prefer that Mi-Sun lead the training?
(A) No, I filed it three months ago. → Incorrect (unrelated to training leadership)
(B) I just gave them to the director. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)
(C) I don't think she works here anymore. → Correct (explains why Mi-Sun can't lead)

28. We should get some feedback on this book cover design.
(A) Ahmed has a visual arts degree. → Correct (suggests a source for feedback)
(B) They probably skipped a week. → Incorrect (unrelated to feedback)
(C) It was really hard to hear. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the design)

29. Would you be able to delay the meeting?
(A) How much storage does it have? → Incorrect (unrelated to delaying the meeting)
(B) Most people seemed to enjoy it. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the request)
(C) Tatyana needs to leave for the airport in an hour. → Correct (provides a reason to delay)

30. Will you rent a car or take the train while you're visiting?
(A) They found some near the coast. → Incorrect (unrelated to transportation choice)
(B) I don't like driving in the city. → Correct (implies preference for train)
(C) Mostly some old desks. → Incorrect (irrelevant to the question)

31. Seven thirty at night is rather late for a meeting, isn't it?
(A) If people agree on it, I will. → Incorrect (vague and unrelated to time concern)
(B) I promise I'll keep it short. → Correct (addresses the late timing concern)
(C) I am not sure who he meant. → Incorrect (unrelated to the meeting time)
